result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy L. Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Marijuana. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.
  • Possession of Drug Paraphernalia. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: DE shall have a payment plan of $25.00 per month commencing 5/01/16 until paid in full.

records.addlTxt: DE shall have a payment plan of $25.00 per month commencing 5/01/16 until paid in full.

Defendant Jeremy L. Thomas in court with attorney Erika Caroline Bahnson.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Set for 3-14-16 @ 8:30AM, RH  Review hearing scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Case recalled-Agreement reached.  State will amend Ct's 2,3 to county ordinances, Ct 1 will be DRI.  DE will pay a fine of $263.50 on both counts, PP of $25.00 per month commencing 5-01-15.

No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Defendant is not to possess or consume any medications not prescribed by a physician.  Not to possess or consume any illicit substances.  All prescribed medications must remain in the original container and be taken only as prescribed.

All prescribed medications must remain in the original container and be taken only as prescribed.   Set for 2-16-16 @ 3:30PM
